Enable this option use sendmail binary to deliver mails. You will need to configure postfix or similar to have them relay to Amazon SES, documentation is available here.

Enter the API keys and Merchant ID from the Account > My User > API Keys, Tokenization Keys, Encryption Keys > View Authorizations page in your Braintree Account.

If you wish to enable PayPal support, please follow the instructions.

The merchant account ID is listed under the Settings > Processing page.

Note: By default, Braintree does not support multiple currencies. The currency value you may select for your purchasable items will be ignored.

To support multiple currencies, you need to set this up by contacting Braintree and ask them to create multiple Merchant Accounts. It is the Merchant Account which dictates which currency transactions will be processed in. You must specify which Merchant Account to use here.
Support recurring billing with following Plan ID

If you wish to support recurring billing for a purchasable item it must be specifically enabled here and you must provide the Plan ID you wish to use for any purchases made with this profile in your Braintree Account.

To support recurring billing and automatically reversing purchases when a payment dispute is opened, please ensure you enable Webhooks with the following URL otherwise you will have to monitor and manage this manually:

{boardUrl}/payment_callback.php?_xfProvider=braintree

Please confirm that you want to delete the following rating. All ratings of this type made on posts will be permanently deleted and users' rating totals will be decreased when you next recount ratings. If you wish to soft delete this rating use the 'disable' feature instead.

If you choose to continue, the per-post rating cache will be rebuilt, any deleted users or ratings will be cleaned up, any 'like ratings' not stored as XF likes will be irreversibly converted to XF likes, and all users' given and received post rating totals will be recounted. This process may take up to several hours on very large sites. Taking a backup beforehand is strongly recommended.

Tämä sivu kertoo kuinka evästeet ovat käytössä tällä sivustolla.

Mitä evästeet (cookies) ovat

Evästeet ovat pieniä tiedostoja, jotka tallentuvat tietokoneellesi selaimen kautta (esim. Internet Explorer, Chrome tai Firefox) websivun pyynnöstä.

Evästeet tallentuvat tietokoneellesi hetkellisesti (esim. selaimen ollessa päällä) tai pidemmäksi aikaa, jopa vuosiksi. Emme pääse käsiksi evästeihin, jotka eivät ole tulleet tältä sivustolta

Evästeiden käyttö tällä sivustolla

Tämä sivusto käyttää evästeitä monessa paikassa:

  • Asetuksiesi rekisteröinti ja ylläpito. Tähän sisältyy sen varmistaminen, että pysyt kirjautuneena sisään, ja että sivusto pitää kielen ja ulkoasun sellaisena kuin olet sen asettanut.
  • Tilastot. Tämä mahdollistaa meidät tarkkailemaan käyttäjien sivujen käyttöä, jotta voimme parantaa käyttökokemusta.
  • Mainostusta avustavat evästeet (mahdollisesti kolmannen osapuolen). Jos tämä sivusto näyttää mainostusta, mainostajat voivat asettaa omia evästeitään tarkkaillakseen, ketkä ovat nähneet mainokset. Nämä evästeet saatetaan asettaa kolmansien toimesta, missä tapauksessa tällä sivustolla ei ole mahdollisuutta muokata näitä evästeitä.
  • Muita kolmannen osapuolen evästeitä ovat esimerkiksi Facebook- tai Twitter-jakamiseen tarkoitetut evästeet. Nämä evästeet ovat tavallisesti asetettu kolmansien osapuolien toimesta, joten tällä sivustolla ei ole pääsyä niihin.

Evästeiden poistaminen/kytkeminen pois käytöstä

Evästeiden hallinta tapahtuu selaimesi asetuksien kautta. Tässä on lista oppaita, kuinka tehdä se suosituimmilla selaimilla:

  • Internet Explorer
  • Firefox
  • Chrome
  • Safari
  • Opera

Your callback should return the unique ID of the media being requested, and have a signature as follows:

public static function matchCallback($url, $matchedId, array $site)
Use 'Match URLs' as PCRE regular expressions

#http://www\.example\.com/video/(?P<id>\d+/[a-z0-9_]+)/#siU

oEmbed is an open format for allowing representation of a URL on third party sites. If a media source provides an oEmbed option, you can fetch rich information about a requested resource and render in-depth HTML with it.

Note: when enabling oEmbed, any HTML entered in the 'Embed template' field is ignored, as are call-backs defined in 'Embed HTML callback'. Additionally, XenForo handles only JSON responses from oEmbed sources.

More information and examples at oEmbed.com

If enabled, a small date block will be offset next to the article excerpt.
Excerpts will be trimmed to this many characters if no [prebreak] is found. (0 to disable)
If selected, any threads in the feature slider will be hidden from the articles list.
Icons will be placed above the excerpt, instead of to the side.
The maximum number of articles to display on each page of the news page.
If selected, you will enable a multi-column layout based on Masonry
Every user will be able to view article list items, regardless of permissions.
Pager will be removed and next page of contents will auto-load when scrolling.
If enabled, excerpt text will be stripped of line breaks and appear as a continuous paragraph.
Hide the bread box and title bar on the article index.
Only selected classes will be extended into the widget framework. You can disable them to save a query.
Uploaded feature slider images will be resized DOWN to this maximum size.
The frequency at which the carousel will auto-rotate in milliseconds. (0 to disable)
Excerpts will be trimmed to this many characters in all cases. (0 to disable)
Slides will be normalized to this height, no matter the size of the source images.
The maximum number of feature slides to display on the articles index. (0 to disable)
You can define a CSS element here and the slider will be detached and inserted before it.
The speed at which transitions will process in milliseconds.
This will be placed inside the meta description tag for the portal page, so avoid using HTML. Leave blank to use XenForo Board Meta Description.
Display a 24-hour clock when selecting the date/time of promotions.

Threads within these forums will automatically be formatted to look like an article. They won't actually have an article promotion data-set; and thus will use the default article settings. Using this feature will result in a small performance hit.
In order to use Disqus, you must set your predefined Disqus shortname.
If an article does not contain a selected promotion icon, the system will search for an appropriate one automatically.
This will allow you to use any images included using the [IMG] tag as a promotion icon.
You may choose to disable full WYSIWYG editing when promoting.
If specified, all visitors will view articles using the selected style, regardless of their personal style preference.
With the new tagging system in XenForo 1.5, you may not want to use the sub-category system. Disabling this option will simply remove the sub-category section of the article view.

You can define classes here to extend the widget framework. Separate each with a line break.
This setting should absolutely not be messed with unless you know exactly what you are doing!
Shows an indicator for both password boxes to inform the user if they're valid.

If force reject is enabled, this list will serve as blacklist and reject all passwords that contain at least one of the given values. If force reject is disabled, every item on this list will give a penalty on the overall password strength.
Passwords containing anything from the blacklist and/or the board title will be rejected if this option is active.
The minimum required length for a users password. All passwords below this threshold will be rejected. Set to 0 to disable.
The threshold to which weaker passwords will be rejected. Set to Very Weak to disable.
What style do you want to use?
Controls the location of the Online Status Ribbon
You can hide the offline ribbon so only the online ribbon is shown.
Choose if users who would normally be hidden will see themselves in Viewing/Read Thread.

Xenforo 1.2/1.3 - Show/Hide users who have hidden their online status from appearing in Who Has Read Thread.
Xenforo 1.4+ Hide users with "show current activity" turned off from appearing in Who Has Read Thread. Users with hidden online status will still be shown.
Enable and choose where in the thread view the container for the Read Thread will appear.
Display users name or avatar for users Read Thread.
Enable and choose where in the thread view the container for Viewing Thread will appear.
Enable/Disable showing Tapatalk users in Viewing Thread
Display users name or avatar for users Viewing Thread.
By default, lazy loading is disabled outside of threads or conversations for areas which use bb code.

Maximum number of users to display before it is displays as "...and X others".
0 to show all usernames always.

Enforced - If you set this option to Enforced then authentication attempts from the Tapatalk application will have to comply with any Two Factor Authentication requirements of the forum, requiring application users to enter a challenge code when prompted.
Bypass - If set to Bypass then users will be able to login with the Tapatalk application bypassing any Two Factor Authentication policies or requirements set on the forum.

Enable support for Open Tagging (@). With this feature enabled, users can input "@username" to tag someone. Tagged users will receive alerts in their web browser and a push notification on their mobile device. To successfully tag someone, there must be one space before and after the "@username".
When doing a prune operation, the number of inactive users must be greater than active users times this fill factor.
When the list of active users per content type is returned, this is the probability that a prune operation will be considered.
Choose to sort by user last activity or by username.
When a user is banned, they can be added to a specific user group while the ban is active. This allows overrides to their user group styling, for example.
If enabled, does an exact string comparison rather than php-standardized version comparison.
By only recompiling changed add-on templates, installing can be dramatically faster.
If set, the install link from updater automatically confirms installing

If enabled, admins will not be able to access the control panel until they have activated two-step verification. This will not affect users currently logged into the control panel until their next login.
You may want to prevent all ads from showing within certain templates, such as errors or other pages that may be against your ad provider's ToS. List them above.
This option will prevent Tapatalk from displaying advertisements. Users in the selected groups will not be served ads when using the Tapatalk app.

Akismet is a service that scans comments and determines if they are spam. If you enter an Akismet API key here, user messages will be checked for spam. You can sign up for an API key via their site. If Akismet determines a message is spam, it will have to be manually approved before being displayed.
User alerts will disappear from the alerts list this many days after being viewed. Unviewed alerts do not expire.
Controls how many alerts are shown on each page of users' full alert list.

The alert popup will show all unviewed alerts, plus any viewed alerts that were viewed within the time frame (in hours) before now. Note that the total amount shown in this popup is limited to no more than 25.
The languages defined here will be available to use inside code BB code with the format of [CODE=xxxx].

This option allows the IP address of a new registration to be checked against IPs recently used by banned or rejected users. If one or more matches is found, the registration will need to be manually approved by an administrator.
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded. Use spaces or line break between extensions.
The maximum allowed dimensions for attached images (width x height). Use 0 or blank to not restrict dimensions.
Provide the maximum attachment file size in kilobytes (KB). Attachments over this size will be rejected.
Use 0 to allow an unlimited number of attachments per message. To disable message attachments, use the permissions system.
The maximum width and height of generated attachment thumbnails.

Enable this option to have the system attempt to automatically embed media from URLs posted by visitors that point to registered media sites. If you choose to include a link to the content as well, the media embedding may be duplicated when the message is quoted.
The major section of the route to the „New Posts“ tab. The default is „find-new“. Change this value only if you use a corresponding route filter.
The minor section of the route to the „New Posts“ tab. The default is „OnlyPosts“. Change this value only if you use a corresponding route filter.
The major section of the route to the „New Posts and Threads“ tab. The default is „find-new“. Change this value only if you use a corresponding route filter.
The minor section of the route to the „New Posts and Threads“ tab. The default is „posts“. Change this value only if you use a corresponding route filter.
The major section of the route to the „New Threads“ tab. The default is „find-new“. Change this value only if you use a corresponding route filter.
The minor section of the route to the „New Threads“ tab. The default is „OnlyThreads“. Change this value only if you use a corresponding route filter.
When the results are shown in the „recent mode“ (tab headings contain „recent“ instead of „new“), remove all other tabs that are not created by this add-on (e.g. „New Profile Posts“)
Enter Forum ID where ban threads will be created.
Ban Threads will be shown as started by this user ID.
Sidebar position for the Banner add-on.
Enable this option to process bounce report from providers. List of supported providers: Mandrill.
Enable this option to send alert emails in addition to builtin notification system. Users still need to enable the option in /account/contact-details to start receiving emails.
Enable this option to re-order suggestion using member message count and last activity.
User groups will show up in suggestion list with a small image. You can use any image you want by uploading to Gravatar and enter the email address here.
Enter a description for your board. This will be placed inside the meta description tag for the forum home page, so avoid using HTML.
When the board is inactive / closed, this message will be shown to site visitors. You may use HTML.
The title of your board. This will be displayed at the top of pages and used in emails.
The primary URL to your board. Do not include a trailing "/" or "index.php". The URL should look similar to this: http://www.example.com/forum

If enabled, the board URL setting will be treated as the canonical installation URL. If visitors access your site through a different URL, they will be redirected to the appropriate canonical URL. When enabled, you must ensure that your board URL setting is correct. If it is not correct, areas outside the admin control panel will not be accessible!
If an email cannot be delivered, the bounce notification will be returned to this email address. If left blank, bounced messages will be returned to the default email address.

A comma delimited list of built-in deployment methods. Supported:
  1. copy
  2. fakeCopy
  3. ftp

Note; if no deployment methods are enabled, then the 'copy' deployment will be enabled.
'fakeCopy' is for testing deployment without copying files.
Sidebar position for the Calendar add-on.
Sidebar position for the Calendar add-on.
CAPTCHAs help prevent spammers from registering or posting.

When enabled, clicking on a link to a category will take you to a dedicated page that only shows the children of that category. When disabled, users will be redirected to the full forum list and scrolled to the correct category.
This character will be repeated for each character in a censored word that does not otherwise have a replacement specified. For example, if "dog" is censored, it may be replaced with "***".

This is a list of words or phrases that are to be censored. If a replacement word or phrase is entered, the censored text will be rewritten to this (for example, replacing "dog" with "cat"). If no replacement is entered, the censored text will be replaced with censor characters (for example, "***").
List the CloudFlare network IPv4 based IP's located on this page: https://www.cloudflare.com/ips-v4
List the CloudFlare network IPv6 based IP's located on this page: https://www.cloudflare.com/ips-v6
Content change log data will be kept for this many days. Use 0 to keep change log data indefinitely.
Email address where board-related messages will be sent.

If enabled, emails sent via the "Contact Us" form will be sent with the sender's info in the "From" header rather than the "Reply-To" header. Enabling this may help with situations where replying to a contact message does not go to the correct address, but it may not be compatible with all SMTP servers.
This is the URL to the page where users will be able to contact you.
The conversations popup will show all conversations with unread replies, plus any read conversations whose most recent replies fall within the time frame (in hours) before now.
Sidebar position for the Countdown add-on.

Which type of badge you want to use?
Based on what you select here, then choose image or icon accordingly below.

If you don't like default badge used as featured badge, you can enter any link to any image. Use direct link to an image, either in your host, or in other site.

If you don't like default badge used as verified badge, you can enter any link to any image. Use direct link to an image, either in your host, or in other site.
There are a few ready to use badges:
styles/default/dadparvar/featuredmembers/verifiedbadge1.png
styles/default/dadparvar/featuredmembers/verifiedbadge2.png

If you check this option, then the extra user info in postbit will be hidden and when you hover over the postbit, it will display it with a smooth effect.

Select the style you want for the notifications.
Silently ignore queries containing the board URL in its entirety either with or without the www prefix. The http:// prefix is necessary for this to be triggered.

This option manages which controllers/actions AzuCloud will be active on. Example uses include threads, forums, pages or anywhere else where the URL varies.
Enter controllers in the format Controller:action,action,action with one controller per line.
The number of days since the last hit that a search term will continue to be displayed for.
Use this to temporarily disable AzuCloud when necessary.
The number of terms to display in each cloud.
Removes search engine operators such as +word, -word, inurl:site.com while keeping the words and links they are prefixed to.

Here you may specify individual exact routes (URLs) to include in addition to the controllers specified above. This is ideal for including things such as individual custom pages. You should specify one route per line with no preceding or trailing slash.
Example usage:
help/trophies
help/terms
If enabled the Post Ratings bar will be displayed above signatures rather than below the standard post controls.
If disabled a maximum of one unread rating alert per post will be enforced.
Disable this option to prevent alerts from Post Ratings and to block alerts from standard likes on posts.
Enable integration into user criteria based systems, such as trophies, notices and group promotions.
After a post receives x number of negative ratings (0 to disable), it will be 'soft hidden' (i.e. with a button to show it again).

A post matching the above option for minimum negative ratings will also be checked against this percentage. Enter 0 to disable this. Any larger value will be treated as a percentage of negative ratings against total ratings that must be met on a post before it is hidden. For example a value of 60 would mean negative ratings would have to make up at least 60% of a post's total ratings before it is hidden.
The rating to use to display likes.
Enable to remove 'Likes Received' on user profiles and display the counts for the rating selected to represent Likes (if any) as part of the Post Ratings stats.
Replaces the Likes You've Received page with 'Ratings You've Recieved' and adds extra page 'Ratings You've Given'
Displays rating totals as a coloured bar on member profile pages.

If enabled, positive and negative rating counts will be displayed where like counts would otherwise be displayed (e.g. member cards, member lists, visitor panel). Additionally the like count will be hidden if likes are set to be displayed as ratings.
Displays rating totals as separate numbers on member profile pages.

The minimum amount of ONE rating the OP of a thread should receive before the top rating is displayed on thread lists next to the thread. In the event of a tie, the rating with lower display order will be shown. Enter 0 to disable this feature.

The opacity of the ratings input bar when the post is not hovered over. Set to 0 to completely hide when not hovered, to 1 if you want to disable the hover effect or use decimal values to have it semi-transparent when not hovered.
Disable this option to prevent news feed/recent activity items from Post Ratings and to block likes on posts from appearing in the news feed.
This option can be safely disabled for a significant performance boost if you are not using the style properties to display each user's rating totals next to posts.
Disable this option to remove all Post Ratings content from the sidebar of member profile pages.
This option allows you to display new posts and threads on your forum in TaigaChat.
If enabled, links to posts and threads generated by the above option will open in a new tab.
Enter a user ID to control what posts are displayed by the above 'Forum activity display' option. Only posts viewable by that user will be displayed. Enter 0 for guest.
Archive posts will be split every x shoutbox messages (lines) entered here.
Enter the ID of a thread above to have shoutbox messages archived to it daily, or enter 0 to disable this feature.
Enter the user ID that archive posts should be made by, or 0 for guest. Whether the user has permission to post in the selected archive thread is not important.

Enter a Group ID to have users who are banned from the shoutbox added to a specified secondary group rather than using the individual user permissions system. This option should be used if you wish to have more control over users banned from the shoutbox, for example you can easily search for users who have been added to the group.
You must create the group yourself and set the permissions on it such that shoutbox access is blocked.
Set to 0 to disable this advanced system and use the basic 'out-of-the-box' shoutbox ban system. Setting to 0 does not disable or break the shoutbox ban functionality.
This option controls which BBCode tags will work in TaigaChat messages.
Tick for latest message at the bottom, untick for latest message at the top.
If selected, the message tools dropdown from the full view will also be displayed next to each message on the sidebar and alternative views.

Enable this option if you receive errors about 'exclusive locks' and/or are using the [bd] Data Storage addon with speed mode enabled. For this to work you must also set the above option to 'HTTPS Compatibility Mode' (does not matter if you are using SSL or not).

(Only applies when Speed Mode is enabled.) This option will force more updates to the 'users in chat' list at the expense of server resources. This option should be enabled for a good user experience on small forums/inactive shoutboxes.
Minimum number of seconds between messages (per user). A permission exists to allow privileged users to bypass this.
The maximum number of seconds between AJAX refreshes when the window and tab are focused by the user.
Number of messages to display at once on the full size TaigaChat view.
The height in pixels of the shoutbox. This affects the sidebar and alternative views, but not the full view.
Hide messages by ignored users entirely, rather than just displaying *Ignored*.
This option controls how images embedded using the [img] tag will be displayed in TaigaChat.
The maximum number of characters allowed per message.
Display mini avatars (16x16px) next to messages.

Message Of The Day to display at the top of the shoutbox in all views. Can be edited outside the Admin CP by anyone with the appropriate permission by double clicking the message. Limited BBCode supported.
If selected, a Shoutbox tab will added to the navigation bar for those with view permissions. If disabled, the full view will still be accessible through clicking the title on the sidebar.

Enable this option to display a small alert balloon on the Shoutbox navbar tab containing the number of users in chat. This will add an extra lightweight query to all pages. On pages containing an instance of TaigaChat, the number will auto-update.
Open links to threads, images, etc. that are part of your forum in a new tab. This option is independent of the above option.

(Only applies when Speed Mode is enabled.) When ticked, this option will prevent the cache buster timestamp being added to speed mode AJAX refreshes, allowing 304 Not Modified responses which will reduce bandwidth and server resource consumption. Only enable this if you know what you are doing and are certain your server will NOT set future expires headers and WILL set appropriate cache-control headers on the .html files in the /data/taigachat folder.
The maximum number of users to display on the 'Users in Chat' widget.
If disabled, the popup view will be unavailable.
The selected route will be used for links and the others will redirect to it.
Displays an alert in the window/tab title (akin to Facebook) when a message is received. Only affects the Full shoutbox view.
Disabling this will provide a resource saving, but you will not be able to use the 'Users in Chat' widget anywhere.
Number of messages to display at once on the sidebar and alternative TaigaChat views.
If disabled, smilies will not be parsed in shout messages.

With this option enabled, the latest messages will be stored in a publicly-viewable file on your web server. XenForo permissions will have no effect on who can VIEW shoutbox messages (if they know what they are doing), including guests and banned users.

Enabling this option will drastically reduce server load and improve performance, as no PHP code or database queries are used to refresh the shoutbox.

Unless discussions in the shoutbox will be strictly private, it is strongly recommended that you enable this option.

If using HTTPS compatibility mode, please ensure your Board URL setting is correct and includes https:// or is protocol agnostic.

This overrides the previous option in browsers that support the necessary API (not Internet Explorer) to provide a different refresh time specifically when the user is on a different tab. In most cases this should be significantly higher than the other refresh times.

This option controls how the timestamp (date/time) next to messages is formatted for display. Please note that the examples are approximate and your unique XenForo settings will affect 12/24 hour display etc.
Enables a toolbar above the message entry box with both the BBCode buttons defined below and a button to insert smilies.

Enter BBCode in the format Title:Code, one per line. (e.g. Link:[url=][/url])
Title also accepts pure HTML; see editor_ui.css for more icons.
The maximum number of seconds between AJAX refreshes when the window is not focused by the user.
Allow Tapatalk users to open thread directly from forum topic subscription email. A "View On Tapatalk" button will be added next to existing "View Thread" button.
Tämä on oletussähköpostiosoite, josta sähköpostit lähetetään
Enter the words or phrases that are disallowed in custom user titles. All censored words are automatically disallowed. Place each word or phrase on separate lines.
You may present discouraged users with a blank page from time to time. Enter the percentage chance of this happening.
Discouraged users will be subjected to a page loading delay of a random period between the two values provided here.
The standard minimum time between messages can be multiplied to make discouraged users wait longer between posting. Enter a multiplier here.
Enter the percentage chance that a discouraged user will be redirected to the redirection page.
You may randomly redirect discouraged users to a different page. Leave this blank to redirect to the forum home page.
When discouraged users attempt to search, this option defines the percentage chance that they will find it disabled. (0 = never, 100 = always)
If enabled a discussion/thread preview will appear when hovering over the title.
The maximum number of characters of content to include in RSS feeds. Note that this includes any BB code mark up used in the message. 0 will disable content from being included in RSS feeds.
This controls the maximum number of discussions (such as threads) that will be shown on one page.
When a logged in user has unread conversations or unviewed alerts, the total count can be displayed in the user's browser tab before the title, or an indicator displayed on the favicon, or both.
Sidebar position for the Doppler add-on.

If enabled, an avatar will by dynamically created for users without a custom avatar. This will include a letter and a color based on their username. If disabled, all users without an avatar will receive a default placeholder.

If enabled, moderators will be able to see historical versions of messages and compare changes between them. Historical data will be pruned after the specified number of days. Use 0 to keep the history forever.
If enabled, any edit after the delay will cause a "last edited" message to be displayed at the end of the message.

This option allows the "Bounced Email Address" account to be automatically read and processed for bounced email reports. This will detect if emails sent to a user bounce, forcing the user to update their email address and preventing the system from emailing them until this happens. This can help reduce the chance of email sent from your board from being considered spam.

This option will read and remove emails from the specified account when processing. It MUST be directed to an account whose sole purpose is collecting bounce emails from this XenForo installation. A value must be entered for the "Bounced Email Address" option.

With this option enabled, notification emails sent to conversation recipients will contain the full text of the message about which they are being notified. With this option disabled, they will need to visit the forum to read the message.
If enabled, and no email address is provided, the warning emails will be sent to the contact email address.
Select this if English is not the default language.
Limit the number of results to display.
If specified, emails sent by XenForo will default to being from this name. If no value is entered, the board name will be used.
If a user clicks this button the user will be prompted to create a new email using their default email client.

If automated bounce processing is enabled, this criteria will be used to determine when multiple soft bounce failures will be considered permanent and emails will no longer be sent to the user.

All threshold values are limited to bounces generated in the last 30 days.

With this option enabled, notification emails sent to users watching threads will contain the full text of the message about which they are being notified. With this option disabled, they will need to visit the forum to read the message.
If enabled, people will be able to browse an alphabetical list of users. This can have performance implications with a large number of users.
With this option disabled, viewing the news feed will be completely disabled.
If you don't use the notices system, you can completely disable it and save a query on session creation.
With this option disabled, the search engine will not function.
Tagging is a system that allows keywords to be applied to content to aid searching and content browsing.
If enabled your users can be awarded trophies for completing certain actions or reaching certain milestones. If disabled, the user title ladder will no longer be able to use Trophy Points.

If enabled, sent emails will include the recipient email address in the bounce address field. This enables more accurate and more secure automated bounce email handling. If using automated bounce processing, enabling this option is strongly recommended.

This option requires that the specified bounce account is a catch-all account or supports a "+" as a wildcard separator (such as in Gmail). For example, if this option is enabled with a bounce address of bounce@example.com, the email might be returned to bounce+123abc+user=domain.com@example.com.
This option can't be edited manually. It is edited only via the "captcha" option.

If this feature is enabled, a Facebook 'Like' or 'Recommend' button will be displayed on various pages including the thread view page, allowing Facebook users to 'Like' the page and in doing so, share it with their Facebook friends.

This feature does not require the Facebook application ID or application secret fields to be completed.
Deep-Linking Thread from Link in Facebook App.
Users will have to wait this many seconds between posting messages. Users with the permission "Can Bypass Flood Check" will be exempt from this option.
Controls the source of the Font Awesome library. You may host this yourself (Local) or use the recommended CDN source.
idebar position for the XenForo Forum Statistics block.
When entering the forums section, this will be the default page users will be taken to. They will be able to access the alternative page via sub-navigation options.

Tapatalk will show a one-time welcome screen to mobile web users informing them to download and view your forum in the free app. This screen will contain your forum branding only along with a download button.
Tapatalk will show a smart banner to mobile users, when your forum is viewed by a mobile web browser. The smart banner will contain two buttons: "Open in app" and "Install".
The URL specified here will be used to give information (such as a map) about a physical location. The URL must include a {location} token.
You may enter your Google Analytics web property ID here to have the Analytics HTML automatically added to your public-facing pages.
Deep-Linking Thread from Google Search Result.

If enabled, your users may source their avatars from Gravatar. When a new user registers, XenForo will automatically search for a Gravatar associated with their email address. If disabled, this will not remove Gravatars from users that already have them.
In order to maximise your 'signal to noise' ratio when displaying threads to guests, you may hide your members' signatures.
All dates and times will be displayed to guests in this time zone.
Hide forums and sub-forums you do not wish to be listed in Tapatalk
This is the URL to your home page, outside of the board. If this is left blank, 'Home' will not appear in the navigation.

If a value greater than 0 is entered, images cached by the image proxy will be refreshed after this many days have passed. This can be used in conjunction with a long cache lifetime to allow images to be updated periodically while retaining resilience against the image being removed. If a value of 0 is entered, images will only be updated when the cache entry expires.

Enter the number of days that proxied images should be retained for, before they are removed from your system. If the image is re-requested after this time, it will automatically be fetched again. Use 0 to retain the images indefinitely.
XenForo can make use of various different image processing libraries to produce image thumbnails etc. Select your preferred library from the list above.

By enabling these options, you may proxy and cache images and links posted in messages through your own server, allowing tracking of clicks etc. Proxying of images is especially important if you are running your site through SSL (HTTPS).

If you have enabled the image or link proxy, this secret key will ensure that images and links are only proxied if the requests originated at your forum. If you find that links are being accessed via third-party sites, you can change this secret key to expire these links. All links stored on the forum will be automatically updated to use the new secret key.

This option controls the length of time for which the proxy logs will be maintained after the last request made to an image or a link. If an entry is not requested for this amount of time, its data (including first request time and total accesses) will be removed. Image proxy logs will never be removed unless the image data has been removed (Image Cache Lifetime). Use 0 to disable pruning of the logs.

If enabled, whenever a proxied image or link is accessed, referrer information will be maintained. This can be viewed in the logs to determine where the image or link has been mentioned. Use 0 to keep the referrer data forever.
This is the maximum file size for images that are displayed through the image proxy system. An image larger than this will return a placeholder image instead. You may use 0 to disable the limit.
Select the forums you wish to exclude.
Email topics are limited to this number.
Email will be sent if inactive less than or equal to this many days.
Email will be sent if less than or equal to this many posts.
Email will be sent if inactive greater than or equal to this many days.
Email will be sent if greater than or equal to this many posts.
By default threads are sorted by most viewed only. To additionally sort by forum title, select this option.
To send a test email, enter User ID, click Save Changes and run Inactive Members Cron Entry manually. Enter 0 to disable this function.
With this disabled, a URL such as /threads/my-thread.128/ would exclude the title and be output as /threads/128/

If you wish to change the default index page of the forums, you may enter the route path here. The route path is the section of the URL to a page after your main forum directory URL, such as forums/ or pages/page-name/. Do not reference a route filter here.

Controls the source of the jQuery core JavaScript library. You may host this yourself (Local) or use one of the recommended CDN sources. Google and Microsoft both support HTTPS/SSL, but the jQuery CDN does not.

The Unix time stamp of the last JS update. This can be changed to force a JS recache even if the XF version doesn't change.
If a discussion spans multiple pages, the last few pages are displayed on the discussion list. Set the maximum number of pages to show here. Set the number to 0 to disable this feature.

If this option is enabled, the LightBox overlay in which images are loaded will show all attached and hot-linked images from all messages on the current page. If disabled, the LightBox will show only images from the current message.

Explicitly defines the location of your favicon.ico file. If this is not filled in, it will automatically try to use a favicon.ico file in your web root.
This is the minimum time the client will wait before asking for another request for updates from the server. In seconds.

The target of the link-forum must be a relative location to support tab selection (e.g. members/ or index.php?members/). It uses relative URI matching. This works well in many situations but not always.

You must first enable Display As Tab for a node before you can select it here. Functionally this makes it so the selected node is treated as a parent of all nodes for the purpose of creating a new tab with this addon. The most obvious application is to create a root tab with a sufficient Depth Of Child Links to display the entire node tree in the popup menu.

Node tabs always support tab selection, but for the root node this might not be desirable. For example, you might want a root node that functions solely as a popup menu to quickly access the node tree. When a tab becomes selected that popup menu is no longer accessible.

If a value greater than 0 is entered, oEmbed data cached by the system will be refreshed after this many days have passed. If a value of 0 is entered, oEmbed data will only be updated when the cache entry expires.

Enter the number of days for which fetched oEmbed data should be retained, before they are removed from your system. If the oEmbed data is re-requested after this time, it will automatically be fetched again. Use 0 to retain oEmbed data indefinitely.

Controls how long oEmbed logs are retained after the most recent request for the referenced oEmbed data. Logs are only removed if the oEmbed data has expired and been pruned. Set this to 0 to disable log pruning.

If enabled, whenever oEmbed data is accessed, referrer information will be maintained. This can be viewed in the logs to determine where the embedded media has been mentioned. Use 0 to keep the referrer data forever.

If this option is enabled, the sitemap will be rebuilt automatically periodically. If this option is disabled, the sitemap will only be updated when it is rebuilt manually through Tools > Rebuild Caches. The current sitemap can be accessed via sitemap.php.

Once a sitemap is built, if this option is enabled, the updated version will be automatically submitted to search engines. If this option is not enabled, search engines will only know about the sitemap if it is listed in robots.txt or if you manually submit it to them.
If you wish to exclude certain content types from the sitemap, that can be done here. Note that content must be guest accessible to be included in the sitemap, regardless of this setting.

If desired, you may include additional URLs that would not otherwise be included in the sitemap. Place each URL on separate lines. Note that these URLs must match your board URL or they will not be included. Partial URLs will be converted to absolute URLs automatically.
These are the default options that will be checked when running the spam cleaner. The individual who actually runs the spam cleaner will have the opportunity to alter these options.

This controls what happens to messages made by spammers when the spam cleaner is applied against them. Note that if content does not support removal from view, it will be permanently deleted regardless of this setting.

When any of these phrases are entered in a message, the action below will be taken. Enter one phrase per line. You may use a * as a wild card to match any words. If you start the line with /, the line will be treated as a regular expression (example: /test/i).
This controls what happens to threads started by spammers when the spam cleaner is applied against them.
The spam cleaner will only be available to act against users who meet these criteria. If any of these criteria are set to 0 (zero) they will be ignored.

Displays an alternative login bar for Steam that mimics other XenForo login bars. Not recommended by Valve because their official images represent the Steam brand to users. Overrides Steam Login Button option if enabled.

Polls the Steam Web API for game statistics on a user during registration. Disabling will reduce API requests, however, stats won't exist for the user until the cron runs.
Controls the source of the images from the Steam CDN. Not all CDN options support HTTPS/SSL. Steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net (HTTPS/HTTP) is recommended, unless you have issues with protocol relative links.
Only display Steam statistics from appids in this list. Comma delimited. Example: 440,550,4000 would only show stats from Team Fortress 2, Left 4 Dead 2, and Garry's Mod.

Controls the source of the API call. If you want to grab JSON over HTTPS instead of HTTP, change to HTTPS only if cURL is enabled and supports HTTPS OR openssl for PHP is installed if cURL is not enabled.

Check new registrations against the StopForumSpam database.

StopForumSpam will test the data collected from registering users and attempt to determine if they are a known spammer. Each warning flag that the user generates will be counted. Flags include user name, email and IP address.
You may choose to only count hits against the spam database that have previously been reported a certain number of times.
Only count flags recorded at least this many times
If selected, the user's email address will be converted to an MD5 hash before submission. This reduces the number of checks which are possible, including blacklist checks.
In order to avoid false positives, you may opt to only count hits against the spam database that have been previously recorded within a limited time period.
Only count flags recorded within the last X days
Moderate registrations when this many warning flags are detected
Specify the number of warning flags (1-3) that are required for a registration to be placed in the moderation queue rather than accepted automatically.
Reject registrations when this many warning flags are detected

Specify the number of warning flags (1-3) that are required for a registration to be automatically rejected. This number should be equal to or greater than the value for the moderation threshold above.
Submit spammer information to StopForumSpam using API key

If you have an API key from StopForumSpam, you may have spammer activity on your site automatically reported back to StopForumSpam in order to improve the database for other users. This option will cause users who are banned via the spam cleaner to be reported.

Settings controlling the thickness and color of structural borders, as well as global settings for element spacing and padding.

Settings related to the layout of pages and how they respond to different viewport sizes. Also styling for some universal elements.

Palveluntarjoaja ("Me", "Meidän") ylläpitämä sivusto ("Palvelu") ei ole vastuussa mistään jäsenen ("Jäsen") tuottamasta sisällöstä ("Sisältö"). Jäsen on itse vastuussa tuottamastaan sisällöstä.

Jäsen sitoutuu siihen, ettei tuota palveluun sisältöä, joka on halventavaa, loukkaavaa, vihamielistä, uhkaavaa, roskapostia tai roskapostin kaltaista, saattaa loukata, sisältää henkilökohtaisia tietoja muista, rikkoa tekijänoikeuksia, kannustaa laitonta toimintaa, tai olla muuten lain vastaista. Kilpailevan sivuston mainostaminen tai mainostaminen on myös kielletty.

Mikäli Jäsen löyttää palvelusta jonkinlaisen vian tai ongelman, on palvelun jäsen on velvollinen ilmoittamaan siitä palvelun ylläpitäjille, tai suoraan palvelun omistajalle.

Meillä on myös oikeus lukea, muokata tai poistaa jäsenen kirjoittamaa tai tekemää sisältöä.

Nämä säännöt ja käyttöehdot voivat vaihtua milloin vain ilman, että siitä ilmoitetaan tai kerrotaan käyttäjälle.

Jos et hyväksy näitä sääntöjä, älä rekisteröidy Palveluumme. Mikäli haluat sulkea tunnuksesi, ota ylläpitoon yhteyttä.
